title: [Large-scale] Problem-Based Learning Process for Developing Consciousness Level Assessment Apps

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Mobile App Usage Experience and Intermediate-Level Mathematical Concepts
context.additional_context: A process for pre-service teachers to develop mathematical problem-solving skills while experiencing an educational app development process applicable to real-world medical education contexts

learning_goals: Learners can design two or more core features of a consciousness-level assessment app by applying problem-based learning (PBL) methodologies.

Within five days (40 hours), learners can develop a prototype HTML/CSS/JS-based digital assessment system that converts and visualizes (graphs/tables) GCS scores (eye, verbal, motor responses) on 4-6 point scales using linear regression and fuzzy logic techniques, meeting the following criteria: 1) implementation of three-item input functionality, 2) 90%+ conversion accuracy, 3) responsive web design

In teams of 3-4, learners can analyze two user interface optimization problems from real development projects, design solutions using instructional design approaches (one user test, three WCAG 2.1 accessibility improvements), and submit 10-15 minute presentation materials (PPT/PDF) achieving 'excellent' ratings in at least four of five rubric criteria

resources: Low-Code App Development Platform (e.g., MIT App Inventor)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
